page.title: 02THE CLAPPERS (continued)
page.content: At the entrance to the site there is a small, fenced car park and a large wooden gate which opens onto a made-up path leading to the Clappers. A part-time warden has overall responsibility for the upkeep of the area and he is assisted throughout the year by groups of volunteers who regularly maintain the area. In the 1980's a small Iron Age Fort was partially excavated. This revealed that the Fort had originally been surrounded by a wooden palisade. The supposed Iron Age earthworks were found to be Medieval in origin and proved to be an artificial rabbit warren that had been constructed at that time to serve the needs of the Manor House which was situated in the area near to Bury Farm, at the foot of the Clappers. The name Clappers, in fact, is derived from the Medieval
